name: UITableViewDiffableDataSourceReference
desc: The Swift representation of the Objective-C object you use to manage data and provide items for a table view.

items.name: init(tableView: UITableView, cellProvider: UITableViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceCellProvider)
items.desc: Creates a diffable data source with the specified cell provider, and connects it to the specified table view.

items.name: typealias UITableViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceCellProvider
items.desc: A closure that configures and returns a cell for a table view from its diffable data source.

items.name: func itemIdentifier(for: IndexPath) -> Any?
items.desc: Returns an identifier for the item at the specified index path in the table view.

items.name: func indexPath(forItemIdentifier: Any) -> IndexPath?
items.desc: Returns an index path for the item with the specified identifier in the table view.

items.name: func sectionIdentifier(for: Int) -> Any?
items.desc: Returns an identifier for the section at the index you specify in the table view.

items.name: func index(forSectionIdentifier: Any) -> Int
items.desc: Returns an index for the section with the identifier you specify in the table view.

items.name: func snapshot() -> NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference
items.desc: Returns a representation of the current state of the data in the table view.

items.name: func applySnapshot(NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference, animatingDifferences: Bool)
items.desc: Updates the UI to reflect the state of the data in the snapshot, optionally animating the UI changes.

items.name: func applySnapshot(NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference, animatingDifferences: Bool, completion: (() -> Void)?)
items.desc: Updates the UI to reflect the state of the data in the snapshot, optionally animating the UI changes and executing a completion handler.

items.name: func applySnapshot(usingReloadData: NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference)
items.desc: Resets the UI to reflect the state of the data in the snapshot without computing a diff or animating the changes.

items.name: func applySnapshot(usingReloadData: NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference, completion: (() -> Void)?)
items.desc: Resets the UI to reflect the state of the data in the snapshot without computing a diff or animating the changes, optionally executing a completion handler.

items.name: var defaultRowAnimation: UITableView.RowAnimation
items.desc: The default type of animation to use when inserting or deleting rows.
